entries.meaning: (uncountable, art) A method of making an image by placing a piece of paper against an object and then rubbing over it, usually with a pencil or charcoal.
(uncountable, sexology) The practice of rubbing parts of the body against those of another person for sexual stimulation.

verbs.description: frottage (third-person singular simple present frottages, present participle frottaging, simple past and past participle frottaged)

entries.meaning: To rub, especially to rub onto one surface placed upon another surface that is textured, in order to create a mottled or patterned area on the first surface.
(sexology) To rub parts of the body against those of another person for sexual stimulation.
